meanings.definition: relating to or involving cooperation between different organizations or individuals
meanings.sent1: The interoperative project brought together teams from various companies to work on a common goal.
meanings.sent2: The interoperative nature of the partnership allowed for seamless collaboration between the two groups.
meanings.sent3: The interoperative event planning committee made sure every detail was perfectly coordinated.
meanings.sent4: The interoperative efforts of the volunteers created a harmonious and efficient environment.
meanings.sent5: The interoperative approach led to a successful outcome that benefited everyone involved.

meanings.definition: capable of operating together or interacting with each other
meanings.sent1: The interoperative devices synced effortlessly to provide a smooth user experience.
meanings.sent2: The robots demonstrated their interoperative abilities by completing the task in perfect unison.
meanings.sent3: The interoperative gadgets seemed to communicate with each other like old friends.
meanings.sent4: The interoperative functions of the software ensured compatibility across all platforms.
meanings.sent5: The interoperative system allowed for easy integration of new components without any issues.
